LanguageData.BreakRiskMinorDesc: These colonists are in a poor mood and may have a minor mental break at any time:\n\n{0}
LanguageData.BreakRiskMajorDesc: These colonists are in a very poor mood and may have a major mental break at any time:\n\n{0}
LanguageData.BreakRiskExtremeDesc: These colonists are critically stressed and may have an extreme (and possibly violent) mental break at any moment:\n\n{0}
LanguageData.BreakRiskDescEnding: Check these colonists' Needs tab to see what's bothering them.\n\nTo make colonists feel better, you can do things like make them fancy meals, give them more recreation hours per day and nicer recreation objects, place them in beautiful environments, have them drink and smoke, and much more.
LanguageData.ColonistsNeedRescueDesc:
These colonists are incapacitated on the ground:

{0}
Send another colonist to rescue them and carry them back to bed.

(To rescue, select another colonist, then right click on the victim and select Rescue.)
LanguageData.NeedDefensesDesc: You've been here some time and have probably been seen. Pirate raids will start soon.\n\nYou should prepare defenses, like sandbags or traps.
LanguageData.NeedMinerDesc: You have designated some rocks to be mined, but no colonist has the Mining work type.\n\nAssign a colonist the Mining work type.
LanguageData.NeedWardenDesc: You have a prisoner, but no colonist has the Warden work type.\n\nAssign a colonist the Warden work type.
LanguageData.LowMedicineDesc: You only have {0} medications left in storage.\n\nBuy more medicine from traders.
LanguageData.NoMedicineDesc: You have no medicine left in storage.\n\nBuy more medicine from traders.
LanguageData.NeedColonistBedsDesc:
You have more colonists than you have colonist beds. Someone will lack a place to sleep.

Either make more beds, or change a prisoner bed to a colonist bed.

If you have no resources, sleeping spots are free and can be placed instantly.
LanguageData.AlertColonistLeftUnburiedDesc: A colonist is left unburied.\n\nThis may negatively affect your colonists' mood.
LanguageData.HunterLacksWeaponDesc: A colonist is assigned as a hunter but does not have a ranged weapon.\n\nThey will not hunt until they are carrying a ranged weapon.
LanguageData.AlertTatteredApparelDesc:
These colonists are wearing tattered apparel, which is making them sad:

{0}
Get them some apparel that isn't so badly damaged.

You can tailor apparel at a crafting spot or tailoring table, or buy it from traders.
LanguageData.AlertUnhappyNudityDesc:
These colonists are nude and not happy about it:

{0}
Get them some clothes.

You can tailor apparel at a crafting spot or tailoring table, or buy it from traders.
LanguageData.NeedFoodHopperDesc:
You have a nutrient dispenser with no hopper next to it.

To work, paste dispensers must draw from an adjacent hopper filled with raw food.

Build a hopper adjacent to the dispenser.
LanguageData.NeedMealSourceDesc:
You have no way of preparing proper meals from raw food.

Build a stove, campfire, or nutrient dispenser.

(It cannot be in a prison cell, otherwise colonists cannot use it.)
LanguageData.CurrentExpectationsAndRecreation: At current expectations ({0}), each tolerance falls by {1} per day awake. Having {2} recreation types is recommended.
LanguageData.NeedBatteriesDesc: You have a solar or wind generator, but no batteries. This means you'll lose power every time the sun goes down or the wind calms.\n\nBuild a battery or two to guarantee sustained power.
LanguageData.BrawlerHasRangedWeaponDesc: One of your colonists has the Brawler personality trait, but is carrying a ranged weapon. This will make them very unhappy.
LanguageData.ShieldUserHasRangedWeaponDesc: One of your colonists has a shield belt and is carrying a ranged weapon. They will not be able to fire their weapon through the shield (except at targets who are already touching them).
LanguageData.NeedResearchProjectDesc: You have the equipment to do research but have not selected a project.\n\nOpen the research menu and select a project.
LanguageData.CaravanIdleDesc: These caravans are waiting for you to set their next destination:\n\n{0}
LanguageData.ColonistNeedsTreatmentDesc:
These colonists need medical treatment. Without it, they may die of their wounds, or their wounds may become permanent.

{0}
Treat them by sending them to a medical bed.

(First, assign a medical bed by selecting it and toggling it into a medical bed. Then, select the wounded colonists and right-click on the medical bed to make them a patient.)
LanguageData.FireInHomeAreaDesc: There is a fire in the home area.
LanguageData.BilliardsNeedsSpaceDesc: One of your billiards table is adjacent to an obstruction that will prevent colonists from using it.\n\nA billiards table needs clear space around it on all sides to be usable.
LanguageData.HunterHasShieldAndRangedWeapon: Hunter has shield and ranged weapon
LanguageData.HunterHasShieldAndRangedWeaponDesc: One of your hunters is using a ranged weapon and wearing a shield belt which prevents shooting at range.\n\nThey won't be able to hunt unless the shield is removed.
LanguageData.NeedWarmClothesDesc1: At least {0} of your colonists will lack warm clothes when the cold season comes.
LanguageData.NeedWarmClothesDesc1All: All of your colonists will lack warm clothes when the cold season comes.
LanguageData.NeedWarmClothesDesc2: The outdoor temperature is going to reach {0}.\n\nYou can tailor warm clothes at the tailoring bench, or buy them from traders.
LanguageData.ImmobileCaravanDesc: One of your caravans is immobile because it carries too much.\n\nYou can make the caravan mobile again by abandoning some items in the ITEMS tab.
LanguageData.BuildingCantBeUsedRoofedDesc: One or more of your buildings can only be used if not roofed, but there is a roof over it. The building(s) won't be usable until you remove the roof.
LanguageData.QuestPartMoodBelowThresholdDesc: The quest {0} requires you to keep this person in a good mood. However, their mood is poor. Take some action to make them feel better:\n\n{1}
LanguageData.QuestPartShuttleLeaveDelayDesc: The shuttle will leave in {1}. The quest {0} requires you to load the following people or items onto the shuttle before it leaves:\n\n{2}
LanguageData.QuestPartShuttleArriveDelayDesc: A shuttle will arrive in {1}. The quest {0} requires you to load the following people or items onto the shuttle before it leaves:\n\n{2}
LanguageData.DisallowedBuildingInsideMonumentDesc: You've built a disallowed building inside one of your monuments. The monument will be considered destroyed in {0}.
LanguageData.ActivatorCountdownDesc: There is a countdown activator ticking down, preparing to awaken nearby mechanoids.
LanguageData.ActivatorCountdownDescMultiple: There are {0} countdown activators ticking down, preparing to awaken nearby mechanoids.
LanguageData.AlertAnimalFilthDesc:
A filth-producing animal is indoors on a clean floor.

Animals produce a very large amount of filth when moving around on normal floors. Keep filth-producing animals outdoors, or on straw matting where they will produce far less filth.

You can check an animal's filth production rate in its stats by clicking the 'i' button.

These animals are the problem:
{0}
LanguageData.AlertAnimalPenNeededDesc: Some of your tame animals are roamers. If not kept in an animal pen, they will wander away.
LanguageData.AlertAnimalPenNeededNoHandlers: You do not have any handlers to take animals to a pen.\n\nAssign a colonist to the Handling work type.
LanguageData.AlertAnimalPenNeededLowSkillHandlers: None of your assigned handlers have the required animals skill needed to take the following animals to a pen.
LanguageData.AlertAnimalPenNeededDescExplanation:
Create an animal pen by building a pen marker inside a fenced, barricaded, or walled area. Select the pen marker to see which animals it accepts and how many its pen can support.

Your animal handlers will bring animals to their assigned pen automatically.

A pen needs a door or gate to admit animals.
LanguageData.AlertAnimalPenNotEnclosedDesc:
An animal pen marker is not enclosed.

Enclose the pen using fences, barricades, gates, walls, or doors to prevent animals from wandering out.

If you have only unenclosed pen markers, your handlers can still lead wandering animals back home - but this must be repeated from time to time when the animals wander away once again.
LanguageData.AlertAnimalIsRoamingDesc:
Some of your tame animals are roamers and have started to wander. If they reach the edge of the map, they will eventually leave.

If you have an enclosed animal pen, your animal handlers can bring the animal back. Animals in an animal pen will not roam.

The following animals are roaming:

{0}
LanguageData.AlertPennedAnimalHungryDesc:
Some of your penned animals are hungry.

Select a pen marker and use the Food tab to see more detail.

Grass-eating animals may need a larger pen to provide enough grass. Other animals may need to be supplied with haygrass or similar food using a stockpile.

The following penned animals are hungry:

{0}
LanguageData.AlertTimedRaidsArrivingInDesc: Enemies have been attracted to the following sites and will start arriving in force soon.\n\n{0}
LanguageData.FactionWillBecomeHostileIfNotLeavingWith: Faction will become hostile if you stay
These factions will become hostile if you stay for longer at their settlement or outpost:\n\n{0}
LanguageData.MainPageCredit: A story generator by Tynan Sylvester
LanguageData.DesignatorCancelDesc: Cancel designated building, mining, hauling, harvesting, and all other designations.
LanguageData.DesignatorCutPlantsDesc: Marks plants to be cut and destroyed. The plant will be completely removed, and any food or resource yield will be harvested.
LanguageData.DesignatorDeconstructDesc: Deconstruct this and reclaim part of its resources.
LanguageData.DesignatorUninstallDesc: Uninstall this so it can be moved, sold, or installed somewhere else.
LanguageData.DesignatorHarvestDesc: Marks plants to be harvested for their food or other products.
LanguageData.DesignatorHarvestWoodDesc: Marks trees to be chopped down for wood.
LanguageData.DesignatorHaulThingsDesc: Mark rock chunks and other items to be hauled to dumping areas. Not needed for things like food or corpses, which are always haulable.
LanguageData.MustHaulHaulables: Can only designate haulable but non-always-hauled things (like rock chunks).
LanguageData.DesignatorHuntDesc: Mark animals to be hunted by your hunters.
LanguageData.DesignatorMineDesc: Designate areas of rock to be mined out.
LanguageData.DesignatorSmoothSurfaceDesc: Designate rough stone terrain and walls to be smoothed.
LanguageData.DesignatorPlanDesc: Place planning designations. These don't do anything except help you plan future expansions.
LanguageData.DesignatorForbidDesc: Mark items as forbidden. Colonists will not be able to interact with the designated items.
LanguageData.DesignatorUnforbidDesc: Mark items as not forbidden. Colonists will be able to interact with the designated items.
LanguageData.DesignatorAreaHomeExpandDesc: Colonists will repair buildings, clean floors, and extinguish fires only in the home area.
LanguageData.DesignatorAreaHomeClearDesc: Removes a home area. Colonists will no longer clean, repair, or extinguish fires here.
LanguageData.DesignatorAreaBuildRoofExpandDesc: Colonists will build roofs in this area.
LanguageData.DesignatorAreaNoRoofExpandDesc: Colonists will remove roofs in this area (except overhead mountain, which cannot be removed).
LanguageData.DesignatorAreaIgnoreRoofExpandDesc: Colonists will ignore roofs in this area.
LanguageData.DesignatorAreaSnowClearExpandDesc: Create a area which colonists will try to keep clear of snow.
LanguageData.DesignatorAreaSnowClearClearDesc: Removes a snow clearing area. Colonists will no longer try to keep this area clear of snow.
LanguageData.DesignatorExpandAreaAllowedDesc: Expand an allowed area.\n\nAllowed areas are defined areas you can assign to colonists. Colonists will not accept work or fulfill their needs outside their allowed area.
LanguageData.DesignatorClearAreaAllowedDesc: Clear cells from an allowed area.\n\nAllowed area are defined areas you can assign to colonists. Colonists will not accept work or fulfill their needs outside their allowed area.
LanguageData.DesignatorGrowingZoneDesc: Create a zone where your colonists will try to grow a certain kind of plant.
LanguageData.DesignatorZoneCreateStorageResourcesDesc: Create a stockpile where your colonists will store resources.\nThis tool can also expand any existing stockpile.
LanguageData.DesignatorZoneCreateStorageDumpingDesc: Create a stockpile where your colonists will store junk.\nThis tool can also expand any existing stockpile.
LanguageData.DesignatorZoneDeleteDesc: Remove zones, like stockpile zones or growing zones.
LanguageData.DesignatorClaimDesc: Claim neutral structures for the colony, including ancient ruins and abandoned siege bases. Claimed structures can be repaired and maintained by your colonists.
LanguageData.DesignatorRemoveFloorDesc: Remove floors to reveal the terrain underneath.
LanguageData.DesignatorRemoveBridgeDesc: Remove bridges to reveal the terrain underneath.
LanguageData.DesignatorStripDesc: Strip apparel from corpses and the wounded.
LanguageData.DesignatorReleaseAnimalToWildDesc: Release an animal back into the wild.
LanguageData.DesignatorStudyDesc: Study this object to learn more about it.
LanguageData.InteractionSpotOutOfBounds: Interaction spot is out of bounds.
LanguageData.InteractionSpotWillBeBlocked: Interaction spot will be blocked by {1_labelShort}.
LanguageData.SurfaceBeingSmoothed: The surface is already marked for smoothing.
LanguageData.TerrainCannotSupport: {0_label} cannot be built on this terrain.
LanguageData.TerrainCannotSupport_TerrainAffordanceFr: {0_label} (when made of {2_label}) requires terrain that supports: {1_label}
LanguageData.MustBeOnMovingWater: The waterwheel must be on moving water.
LanguageData.InteractionSpotWillOverlap: Interaction spot will overlap with the interaction spot of {1_labelShort}.
LanguageData.InteractionSpotOverlaps: Interaction spot overlaps with the interaction spot of {1_labelShort}.
LanguageData.MonumentAdjacentToBuilding: Monument cannot be placed adjacent to: {0}.
LanguageData.NoColonistWithSkillTip: None of your {0} have this skill.
LanguageData.NoColonistWithAllSkillsForConstructing: None of your {0} have all skills required.
LanguageData.AllColonistsWithSkillHaveDisabledConstru: All of your {0} who have this skill are not assigned to {1}.
LanguageData.GameUpdatedToNewVersionInitial: RimWorld has been updated from version {0} to version {1}.
LanguageData.GameUpdatedToNewVersionSavesIncompatible: This may cause saved games and mods from the old version to stop working.
LanguageData.GameUpdatedToNewVersionSavesCompatible: Saved games from the old version should be compatible, however some mods may stop working.
LanguageData.GameUpdatedToNewVersionNonSteam: Since this is a DRM-free copy, you can install the game twice in two different folders, to be able to play both old and new versions.
LanguageData.GameUpdatedToNewVersionSteam:
If you wish to continue with the old version, you can opt in using Steam's "Betas" feature.

 1. In the Steam library, right-click RimWorld.
 2. Click Properties.
 3. Click the Betas tab.
 4. Select the version you want from the drop-down menu.
LanguageData.RecoveredFromErrorsDialogTitle: Recovered from incompatible or corrupted mods errors
LanguageData.RecoveredFromErrorsText:
It seems that some of the active mods were causing errors.

They were incompatible with each other, designed for a different version of RimWorld, or corrupted.

All mods have been disabled and can be activated again in the mods dialog.
LanguageData.ErrorWhileLoadingAssets: An error occurred while loading game assets. See error log for more information.
LanguageData.ErrorWhileLoadingAssets_ModsInfo: The game is currently running with custom mods - they may or may not cause these problems.
LanguageData.ErrorWhileGeneratingMap: An error occurred while generating a new map. See error log for more information.
LanguageData.ErrorWhileLoadingMap: An error occurred while loading a map. See error log for more information.
LanguageData.ModsChanged: The mod list has changed. The game will now restart automatically.
LanguageData.FailedToRestart: Something went wrong while restarting the game. The game can't fully unload modified code from deactivated mods, so code from deactivated mods may still be active.\n\nIt's recommended that you quit and restart the game now to load all mods cleanly.
LanguageData.SteamClientMissing:
Could not initialize Steam API. Possible causes:

-Steam is not running.
-Launched from outside Steam without steam_appid.txt in place.
-Running with different privileges than Steam client (e.g. "as administrator").

In most cases, rebooting your computer will fix this problem.

You can play anyway, but no Steam stats will be recorded and Steam features won't be available.
LanguageData.SaveIsFromDifferentGameVersion: We are running version {0} but the save data is from {1}, which is a different version entirely.\n\nTrying to load this data will probably not work.
LanguageData.SaveIsFromDifferentGameBuild: We are running version {0} but the save data is from {1}, which is a different build.\n\nTrying to load this data should still work.
LanguageData.SaveIsFromThisGameBuild: Save data was saved with our game version and should work without issue.
LanguageData.SaveIsUnknownFormat: Save data is in an unknown format and almost certainly will not load properly.
LanguageData.MissingMods: Some mods are unavailable, and need to be installed
LanguageData.NamePlayerFactionMessage: Since it looks like you'll be here for a while, {0} thinks that you should give your faction a name. What should your faction be called?
LanguageData.PlayerFactionGainsName: Your faction is now known as {0}.
LanguageData.NamePlayerFactionBaseMessage: {0} thinks that you should give this settlement a name. What should the local settlement be called?
LanguageData.PlayerFactionBaseGainsName: This community is now known as {0}.
LanguageData.NamePlayerFactionBaseMessage_NameFaction: {0} also thinks that you should give this settlement a name. What should this local settlement be called?
LanguageData.PlayerFactionAndBaseGainsName: Your faction is now known as {0}, and this community is now known as {1}.
LanguageData.PawnGainsName: This person's nickname is now {0}. {PAWN_possessive} title is {PAWN_title}.
LanguageData.ConfirmResolutionChange: You've changed your screen settings. Do the new ones work okay?\n\nAuto-reverting in {0}...
LanguageData.ConfirmPermanentlyDisableDevMode:
Do you really want to permanently disable development mode on this computer?

This option is for people who want a pure play experience without the temptation to use development tools to gain advantage in normal play.

Development mode can be re-enabled, but doing so requires manually editing configuration files. You'll need to search the Internet to find out how.
LanguageData.MapTemperatureDangerWarning: Warning: You will be landing in a frozen environment. It may be hard or nearly impossible to survive. If you are not intending to face an extreme challenge, choose a different site or season.
LanguageData.MapSizePerformanceWarning: The game is designed to play on medium map sizes. These sizes provide plenty of space!\n\nLarge map sizes don't just degrade performance - they actually break the game design. The AI will make stupid decisions, and game balance will be badly affected in various ways. These sizes are included for tradition and testing reasons only, please do not use them without a specific reason.
LanguageData.RecipeCannotHaveTargetCount: (This recipe cannot have a target count because it has multiple or unpredictable products.)
LanguageData.BillRequiresMayVary: Note: Small-volume ingredients like gold require {0}x as much.
LanguageData.ThisIsSmallVolume: This is a small-volume ingredient. This means that each 'unit' is only 1/{0} as much as a normal-volume ingredient. So, to fill the same ingredient requirement, you'll need {0}x as much as usual.
LanguageData.ArmorPenetrationExplanation: Armor penetration is the amount of armor this weapon will ignore each time it hits the target.\n\nIf armor penetration is greater than the target's armor, it is as though the target is unarmored. Otherwise, the armor penetration is subtracted from the target's armor.
LanguageData.BuildingDamageFactorExplanation: Damage to all buildings is multiplied by this value.
LanguageData.BuildingDamageFactorImpassableExplanatio: Damage to all impassable buildings is multiplied by this value.
LanguageData.BuildingDamageFactorPassableExplanation: Damage to all passable buildings is multiplied by this value.
LanguageData.StoppingPowerExplanation: Hits from this weapon will stagger targets, slowing their movement for several seconds.\n\nTargets with a body size larger than the stopping power will be unaffected.
LanguageData.GrowingTimeDesc:
Plants only grow for part of the day, and only when lit.

This statistic measures the time the plant needs to spend actually growing to reach full size.
The actual real growing time will generally be about twice as long.
Low temperatures also slow plant growth.
LanguageData.CoverEffectivenessExplanation: How effective this is when used as cover in a gunfight.\n\nHigher percentages will block more shots.
LanguageData.WildnessExplanation: Wilder creatures are naturally more difficult to tame, train, and handle.
LanguageData.TamenessWillNotDecay: Tameness will never decay for animals of very low wildness.
LanguageData.TamenessWillNotDecayFenceBlocked: Tameness will never decay for animals that can be kept behind fences.
LanguageData.PackAnimalExplanation: Whether this animal is appropriate to use to carry items in a caravan over long distances.
LanguageData.SkillRequiredToBuildExplanation: Requires this level of {0} in order to build.
LanguageData.NuzzleIntervalExplanation:
How often an animal will nuzzle friendly colonists, on average.

Nuzzling is a behavior shared by many animal species, where the animal presses its nose or muzzle against a friend as a sign of affection.
Most humans find this cute and it will leave them in a good mood for a period of time.
LanguageData.HarmedRevengeChanceExplanation:
The chance this creature will attack when harmed.

This chance increases up to three times if the attacker is closer.

This chance is applied each time damage is taken. This means that so slower-firing, higher-damage weapons are less likely to trigger it while hunting.
LanguageData.RearmCostExplanation: Resources needed to rearm this turret (affected by difficulty).
LanguageData.ShotsBeforeRearmExplanation: How many shots this turret can fire before it has to be rearmed.
LanguageData.AbilityTargetDesc: The types of targets on which this ability can be used.
LanguageData.MeditationFocusesPawnDesc: The types of meditation focus this person can use. When meditating, a person can focus on an obejct to boost their psyfocus gain - but only if that object offers a focus type they can use. Each person's meditation types are determined by their background, traits, social position, and so on.
LanguageData.MeditationFocusesDesc: The types of meditation focus this object offers. A meditating person can focus on this object to boost their psyfocus gain, but only if they are able to use one of its meditation types. Each person can use different meditation types depending on their background, traits, social position, and so on.
LanguageData.BuyPriceDesc: Price you pay to buy this.
LanguageData.SellPriceDesc: Price you receive for selling this.
LanguageData.PriceTypeDesc: For this item, this price is {0}.
LanguageData.ColonyCount: How many of this item the colony has ready to trade.\n\nYou can only sell items to orbital traders if they are near an orbital trade beacon.
LanguageData.TraderCount: How many of this item the trader has to trade.
LanguageData.YourTradeableSilverTip: You can only trade with silver that is near an orbital trade beacon and not under a roof.
LanguageData.TraderWillNotTrade: Trader is not willing to buy this.
LanguageData.NegotiatorTalkingImpaired: Your negotiator {1_labelShort} cannot talk properly because of poor health.
LanguageData.NegotiatorHearingImpaired: Your negotiator {1_labelShort} cannot hear properly because of poor health.
LanguageData.NegotiatorCapacityImpaired: This will affect trade prices.\n\nConsider using a healthier negotiator.
LanguageData.ConfirmTraderShortFunds: Trader has insufficient silver to fully cover this transaction. Proceed anyways?
LanguageData.JoinsAsSlaveDesc: If purchased, this person will join your colony as a slave.
LanguageData.JoinsAsColonistDesc: If purchased, this person will join your colony as a colonist.
LanguageData.TradeCaravanRequestDeniedDueTitle: {FACTION_name} is not willing to send a caravan because {NEGOTIATOR_nameDef} lacks the required title of {TITLE}.
LanguageData.FormCaravanColonyThingCountTip: Number available to send with the caravan.
LanguageData.CaravanMustHaveAtLeastOneColonist: You must assign at least one non-downed colonist.
LanguageData.CaravanCouldNotFindExitSpot: The chosen exit location ({0}) is inaccessible.
LanguageData.CaravanCouldNotFindPackingSpot: Could not find any valid packing spot. Make sure that the chosen exit location ({0}) is accessible.
LanguageData.CaravanCouldNotFindReachableExitSpot: Warning: Some of the assigned colonists are unable to reach the exit location ({0}).
LanguageData.CaravanRoamerCannotReachSpots: {1_labelShort} is unable to reach the packing spot or the exit location when led by any of the assigned colonists.
LanguageData.CaravanItemIsUnreachableSingle: None of the assigned colonists are able to reach the {0}.
LanguageData.CaravanItemIsUnreachableMulti: None of the assigned colonists are able to reach {0}x {1}.
LanguageData.TooBigCaravanMassUsage: The caravan can't carry that much.
LanguageData.CaravanMassUsageTooltip: Includes carried items and equipped items. Carrying less than the maximum gives a speed bonus.
LanguageData.CaravanVisibilityTip:
Visibility is how easy your caravan is to notice.

It multiplies the chance that your caravan will be waylaid by enemies.

Visibility does not affect your ability to find things you want.

Visibility is based on the total body size of all people and animals in the caravan.
LanguageData.DaysWorthOfFoodTooltip:
The approximate number of days before at least one person or animal will be out of food. Different species have different diets, so one may run out of food before others. This value is calculated more accurately after the route is chosen.

Affected by:
 - Current pawn inventory
 - Carried food type and amount
 - Caravan members and their diets
 - Foraging rate
 - Whether animals can graze
 - Time until food rots
 - Hot weather rots food faster
LanguageData.DaysWorthOfFoodTooltip_OnlyFirstWaypoint: (only the first waypoint is taken into account)
LanguageData.DaysWorthOfFoodWarningDialog: Your caravan only has {0} days worth of food and will become hungry quickly.
LanguageData.DaysWorthOfFoodWarningDialog_NoFood: Your caravan has no food and will become hungry very quickly.
LanguageData.ForagedFoodPerDayTip: The average amount of food per day your people will forage. This value will change as you travel across biomes with different forage yield rates.
LanguageData.CaravanFoodWillRotSoonWarningDialog: A large part of the caravan's food will rot soon.
LanguageData.CaravanIncapableOfSocial: You have no caravan members capable of diplomacy or trading.
LanguageData.CaravanAreYouSure: Are you sure you want to form this caravan?
LanguageData.MessageMustChooseRouteFirst: You must choose a route for the caravan first.
LanguageData.MessageNoValidExitTile: Your caravan is unable to leave the area. Make sure that at least one side is reachable.
LanguageData.DaysUntilRotTip: The number of days until this item starts to rot based on the average temperature in this area.
LanguageData.ItemNutritionTip: How much nutrition this food provides.\n\nFor reference: adult person needs {0} nutrition per day.
LanguageData.AnimalCanGrazeTip: This animal can graze food from the environment instead of eating carried food. Grazing is only possible in some biomes and temperature ranges.
LanguageData.NutritionForagedPerDayTip: Nutrition foraged per day. The actual amount foraged is also affected by biome forageability.\n\n{0}
LanguageData.NutritionEatenPerDayTip: Nutrition eaten per day. For reference, simple meals have {0} nutrition.
LanguageData.CaravanFormationProcessStarted: Your colonists will now gather the items and leave the area.
LanguageData.CaravanMovementSpeedTip: Movement speed depends on carried mass, ridden animals, and terrain movement difficulty.
LanguageData.AnimalsWillBeAbleToGraze: Animals will be able to graze
LanguageData.SourceCaravanMustHaveAtLeastOneColonist: You must leave at least one non-downed colonist.
LanguageData.SplitCaravanThingCountTip: How many of this item the caravan has ready to give to the new caravan.
LanguageData.ConfirmAttackFriendlyFaction: Are you sure you want to attack {0}?\n\nThis will make {1} hostile to you, and they will eventually start raiding your colony!
LanguageData.TooBigTransportersMassUsage: The assigned people and items are too heavy for the transport pods.
LanguageData.TooBigTransporterSingleMassUsage: The assigned people and items are too heavy for the shuttle.
LanguageData.CantSendEmptyTransportPods: You can't send empty transport pods.
LanguageData.TransporterItemIsUnreachableSingle: There is no path between the transport pods and the {0}.
LanguageData.TransporterSingleItemIsUnreachableSingle: There is no path between the shuttle and the {0}.
LanguageData.TransporterItemIsUnreachableMulti: There is no path between the transport pods and {0}x {1}.
LanguageData.TransporterSingleItemIsUnreachableMulti: There is no path between the shuttle and {0}x {1}.
LanguageData.HistoryUploadMessage: Do you want to upload your gameplay data records to RimWorld server in order to help developers balance the game? If you agree, your data will be uploaded every {0} days (and in some other rare cases like the end of the game). Privacy preferences can be changed later in the options menu.
LanguageData.HistoryUploadMessagePlayerName: Even though history is sent anonymously, you can attach your name.
LanguageData.HistoryUploadNo: Do not allow uploading gameplay data
LanguageData.HistoryUploadNoOnce: Do not upload this time, ask me later
LanguageData.DrugPolicyInUse: Drugs policy is in use by {0}.
LanguageData.FoodRestrictionInUse: Food restriction is in use by {0}.
LanguageData.DrugUsageColumnDesc: How the drug is allowed to be used.
LanguageData.FrequencyColumnDesc: How often the colonists should try to take this drug.
LanguageData.MoodThresholdColumnDesc: The colonists will take this drug only if their mood level is below this threshold.
LanguageData.JoyThresholdColumnDesc: The colonists will take this drug only if their recreation level is below this threshold.
LanguageData.TakeToInventoryColumnDesc: An amount of the drug to pick up extra when gathering it for consumption, in order to avoid having to visit the drug stockpile every time.
LanguageData.DrugUsageTipForAddiction:
For addictions

Use this drug to feed already-established addiction needs.

Even if disabled, some characters with specific traits, or on mental breaks, may use the drug anyway.
LanguageData.DrugUsageTipForJoy:
For recreation

Use this drug for recreation and social purposes.

Even if disabled, some characters with specific traits, or on mental breaks, may use the drug anyway.
LanguageData.DrugUsageTipScheduled: Scheduled\n\nUse this drug on a defined schedule, when specific conditions are met.
LanguageData.NoGrowerCanPlant: {0} requires {1} skill in Growing to sow.\n\nNone of your non-downed growers have this skill, so this plant will not be sown.
LanguageData.ConfirmAbandonHomeNegativeThoughts: Abandoning {0} will cause the following people to get the following thoughts:
LanguageData.ConfirmMoveAutoJoinableCaravan:
Some animals or prisoners are trying to join this caravan. If you move it, they won't be able to anymore.

Animals, prisoners, and downed colonists left behind in a map without any non-downed colonists are considered abandoned and can be captured by the enemies.

Are you sure you want to move your caravan?
LanguageData.ConfirmBanishPawnDialog: Do you really want to banish {1_label}?
LanguageData.ConfirmBanishPawnDialog_Items: {1_labelShort} will take the following items with {1_objective}:
LanguageData.ConfirmBanishPawnDialog_AllColonistsThou: All colonists will get the following thoughts:
LanguageData.ConfirmBanishPawnDialog_IndividualThough: Banishing {1_labelShort} will cause the following people to get the following thoughts:
LanguageData.ConfirmSendNotCompletelyLoadedPods: Pod group isn't completely loaded. {1_labelShort} is missing. Launch anyway?
LanguageData.ConfirmSettleNearFactionBase: Since this location is within {0} tiles of another faction base, they will feel you are encroaching on their land and relations with those factions will worsen every {1} days.\n\nSettle here anyways?
LanguageData.ConfirmCleanupTranslationFiles:
Are you sure you want to cleanup all translation files for language {0}?

This will:
 - Add placeholders for missing keyed translations, def-injected translations, and backstories
 - Add or update comments containing the original, untranslated text
 - Move all keyed and def-injected translations to the appropriate XML files
 - Apply automatic formatting to all XML files
 - Update back-compatible def names
 - Remove all existing XML comments (except in full-list injections)

Non-XML files will not be removed or modified.

Remember to restart the game after modifying the language files before running this tool in order to reload all data.

Make sure to back up all translation files before using this tool.
LanguageData.TransportersCaravanWillBeImmobile: The caravan will be immobile if you launch to an empty tile. Continue anyway?
LanguageData.ConfirmCancelMonumentMarker: Do you really want to remove this monument marker?
LanguageData.AbilityCannotHitTarget: No line of sight to target.
LanguageData.AbilityCantApplyToScaria: {0_labelShort} has scaria, which can only be treated medically.
LanguageData.AbilityDoesntWorkOnMentalState: {0} doesn't work on the '{1}' mental state.
LanguageData.PsyfocusCostPerMentalBreakIntensity: Psyfocus cost per mental break intensity
LanguageData.AbilityCantGetInspiredNow: {0_labelShort} can't get an inspiration right now.
LanguageData.AbilityMustBeNotSameIdeo: {0_labelShort} must be of a different ideoligion than {1_labelShort}.
LanguageData.AbilityMustBeSameIdeo: {0_labelShort} must be of same ideoligion as {1_labelShort}.
LanguageData.AbilityNeedAllyToSkip: Need ally at target for navigation
LanguageData.FarskipConfirmTeleportingLodger: If you skip {PAWN_labelShort} to another map or a caravan, the associated quest will fail and {PAWN_pronoun} will leave immediately.\n\nDo you really want to farskip {PAWN_labelShort}?
LanguageData.AutoSlaugtherTip: Colonists first slaughter non-pregnant animals in order from oldest to youngest, then pregnant animals from most recent to least recent pregnancy.
LanguageData.AutoSlaugtherHeaderTooltipLabel: The animal to be automatically slaughtered.
LanguageData.AutoSlaugtherHeaderTooltipCurrentTotal: The current number of animals in the colony, both male and female.
LanguageData.AutoSlaugtherHeaderTooltipMaxTotal: The maximum number of animals in the colony, both male and female.\n\nHandlers will automatically slaughter any extras.
LanguageData.AutoSlaugtherHeaderTooltipCurrentMales: The current number of males of breeding age in the colony.
LanguageData.AutoSlaughterHeaderTooltipCurrentMalesYo: The current number of baby and juvenile males in the colony.
LanguageData.AutoSlaugtherHeaderTooltipMaxMales: The maximum number of males of breeding age in the colony.\n\nHandlers will automatically slaughter any extras.
LanguageData.AutoSlaughterHeaderTooltipMaxMalesYoung: The maximum number of baby and juvenile males in the colony.\n\nHandlers will automatically slaughter any extras.
LanguageData.AutoSlaugtherHeaderTooltipCurrentFemales: The current number of females of breeding age in the colony.
The current number of baby and juvenile females in the colony.
LanguageData.AutoSlaugtherHeaderTooltipMaxFemales: The maximum number of females in the colony.\n\nHandlers will automatically slaughter any extras.
LanguageData.AutoSlaughterHeaderTooltipMaxFemalesYoun: The maximum number of baby and juvenile females in the colony.\n\nHandlers will automatically slaughter any extras.
LanguageData.AutoSlaughterHeaderTooltipCurrentPregnan: The current number of pregnant animals in the colony.
LanguageData.AutoSlaughterHeaderTooltipAllowSlaughter: Allow pregnant animals to be slaughtered along with other females of the same species.
LanguageData.AutoSlaughterHeaderTooltipCurrentBonded: The current number of bonded animals in the colony.
LanguageData.AutoSlaughterHeaderTooltipAllowSlaughter: Allow bonded animals to be slaughtered.
LanguageData.AutoSlaughterTooltipSetLimit: Click to set an animal count limit.
LanguageData.StatsReport_MeleeDPSExplanation: DPS = Melee damage * Melee hit chance / Cooldown in seconds
LanguageData.StatsReport_GraveCorpseRelatedAbstract: Meditator is related to the corpse inside
LanguageData.Stat_RecreationType_Desc: Different sources of recreation satisfy different recreation types. Colonists become bored of doing the same recreation type repeatedly, so it is important to provide a variety of recreation sources with different recreation types.
LanguageData.Stat_MineableThing_Desc: The item that will be yielded when mining this.
LanguageData.Stat_MiningYield_Desc: The maximum amount of items yielded when mining this. The actual yield will be adjusted by the mining skill of the miner.
LanguageData.Stat_SourceSpecies_Desc: The species of creature from which this was taken.
LanguageData.Stat_Stuff_Desc: The stuff this thing is made of. This affects many other stats, including weapon damage, apparel armor and insulation, item and building hit points, beauty, market value, and much more.
LanguageData.Stat_Weapon_Desc: The weapon used by this turret.
LanguageData.Stat_HitPoints_Desc: How much damage an object can take before being destroyed.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_WorkToUninstall_Desc: The amount of work it takes to uninstall this.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Fence_Desc: Whether this building is a type of fence. Fences block these animals
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_CreatedAt_Desc: Which facilities can be used to produce this.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Damage_Desc: The amount of damage this weapon deals.\n\nThis may be deflected or mitigated by the target's armor.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_MedicineXpGainFactor_Des: A multiplier on the amount of experience doctors gain when using this to tend a patient.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Apparel_CountsAsClothingNudit: Whether nudists will consider this item to be a piece of clothing. If not, nudists will never be bothered by wearing this.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Apparel_Covers_Desc: Which body parts this covers.\n\nArmor does not protect body parts that it does not cover.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Apparel_Layer_Desc: Which apparel layers this fills.\n\nFor a given body part, only one piece of apparel can be worn in each layer.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Plant_FertilityRequirement_De: The minimum soil fertility that this plant requires to grow.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Plant_FertilitySensitivity_De: How sensitive this plant is to soil fertility.\n\nLow sensitivity means the plant will grow about the same speed in rich or poor soil. High sensitivity means the plant grows slow in poor soil, but faster in rich soil.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Plant_LightRequirement_Desc: The amount of light this plant requires to grow.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Plant_LifeSpan_Desc: The lifespan of the plant.\n\nPlants naturally die after they reach a certain age, even if not harvested.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Plant_HarvestYield_Desc: The amount of product this plant will yield when harvested.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Plant_MinGrowthTemperature_De: The minimum temperature this plant can survive.\n\nTemperatures below this will cause damage over time.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Plant_MaxGrowthTemperature_De: The maximum temperature this plant can survive.\n\nTemperatures above this will cause damage over time.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Plant_MinGrowingSkillToSow_De: The minimum skill needed for a farmer to to sow this plant.
LanguageData.Stat_Race_Diet_Desc: The kinds of food this creature is capable of eating.\n\nCan eat: {0}
LanguageData.Stat_Race_LeatherType_Desc: The type of leather this creature will yield when butchered.
LanguageData.Stat_Race_Animal_TameFailedRevengeChance: The chance that this creature will attack when a tamer tries to tame it and fails.
LanguageData.Stat_Race_Trainability_Desc: This creature's general mental aptitude for training. This is a combination of intelligence and attentiveness. It determines which kinds of tasks this creature can be trained to perform.
LanguageData.Stat_Race_LifeExpectancy_Desc: The average life expectancy of this creature.
LanguageData.Stat_Race_BlockedByFences_Desc: Whether this creature is blocked by fences and barricades.
LanguageData.Stat_Race_RoamInterval_Desc:
How often a tame animal will attempt to roam away and exit the map.

Animals will only roam if they have a direct path to the map edge. You can use fences, barricades, walls, and doors to prevent this.

Animal handlers can rope roaming animals and bring them back to a pen.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Ingestible_Joy_Desc: The recreational value of ingesting this. Higher numbers will fulfill the recreation need more.
LanguageData.Stat_Race_BodySize_Desc: The size of this creature's body, compared to an average adult human.
LanguageData.Stat_Race_Growth_Desc: How close this creature is to adulthood.\n\nGrowth requires nourishment. A hungry animal will grow at a slower rate compared to a well-fed one.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Weapon_MeleeWarmupTime_Desc: How much time passes between when a melee attack with this weapon begins and when it hits.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Weapon_BurstShotCount_Desc: The amount of shots this weapon fires in each burst.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Weapon_BurstShotFireRate_Desc: The fire rate of this weapon during each burst.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Weapon_Range_Desc: The maximum range of this weapon.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Weapon_MissRadius_Desc: The radius of random spread on shots fired by this weapon.\n\nHigh values make projectiles disperse randomly around the target.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Weapon_DirectHitChance_Desc: The chance that a shot will directly hit its target if not intercepted, dodged or stopped.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_MoodChange_Desc: This body part's effect on the mood of the owner.
LanguageData.Stat_Recipe_Skill_Desc: The main skill used while performing this recipe.\n\nIt determines the quality of the result, and is learned while performing this recipe.
LanguageData.Stat_Recipe_Ingredients_Desc: The ingredients required to perform this recipe.
LanguageData.Stat_Recipe_SkillRequirements_Desc: The skills required to perform this recipe.
LanguageData.Stat_Recipe_Products_Desc: The products produced by this recipe.
LanguageData.Stat_Recipe_WorkSpeedStat_Desc: Which character stat governs the workspeed of this recipe.\n\nThe higher the stat of the worker is, the faster work will be done.
LanguageData.Stat_Recipe_EfficiencyStat_Desc: Which stat governs the quality or amount of output.\n\nThe higher the stat of the worker is, the higher the quality or yield will be.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Surgery_SuccessChanceFactor_D: A multiplier on the chance this operation will be a success. More difficult operations have lower multipliers.\n\nThe actual chance of success of a surgery is also affected by the doctor, facilities, and medicine used.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Surgery_SuccessChanceFactor_C: Performing this operation is safe for the patient.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Surgery_DeathOnFailChance_Des: The chance the patient will die upon failure of this surgery.
LanguageData.Stat_Hediff_TotalBleedFactor_Desc: A multiplier applied to the overall rate of blood loss.
LanguageData.Stat_Hediff_NaturalHealingFactor_Desc: A multiplier applied to the overall rate of natural wound healing.
LanguageData.Stat_Hediff_FoodPoisoningChanceFactor_De: A multiplier applied to the chance of getting food poisoning.
LanguageData.Stat_Hediff_BleedingRate_Desc: The rate at which this condition causes blood loss.
LanguageData.Stat_Hediff_Pain_Desc: The amount of pain caused by this condition.
LanguageData.Stat_Hediff_PartEfficiency_Desc: The offset in efficiency applied to body parts affected by this.
LanguageData.Stat_Hediff_HungerRateFactor_Desc: A multiplier on the rate at which the food need depletes.
LanguageData.Stat_Hediff_HungerRateOffset_Desc: An offset on the rate at which the food need depletes.
LanguageData.Stat_Hediff_TirednessOffset_Desc: An offset applied to the rate at which the creatures rest need falls.
LanguageData.Stat_Hediff_TirednessFactor_Desc: A multiplier applied to the rate at which the creatures rest need falls.
LanguageData.Stat_Hediff_PreventsInfection_Desc: Whether or not this will prevent infections.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_TerrainRequirement_Desc: This can only be placed on terrain of these types.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Terrain_Fine_Desc: This floor is considered fine and suitable for royalty.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_PowerConsumption_Desc: The amount of power this building will draw from the power grid.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_ReloadChargesRemaining_Desc: The number of {CHARGENOUN_plural} remaining on this object. If these run out, the special ability can no longer be used.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_ReloadMaxCharges_Desc: The maximum number of {CHARGENOUN_plural} this object has.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_ReloadRefill_Desc: The amount of items required to fully reload this object.\n\nThis object can be reloaded before it is empty, but the cost is the same as if it was empty.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_ReloadPerCharge_Desc: The amount of items required to reload one {CHARGENOUN}. Multiple {CHARGENOUN_plural} can be reloaded at once.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_ReloadDestroyOnEmpty_Desc: This item will vanish when its last {CHARGENOUN} is used.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_BodyPartEfficiency_Desc: The overall efficiency of this body part.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Biocoded_Desc: This item has been coded to only accept a particular individual's bio-signature.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_Chemical_Desc: The active chemical in this.\n\nIn some cases, the same chemical is present in multiple different drugs. These different drugs will satisfy the same addiction in different ways.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_Category_Desc: The category this drug belongs to.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_HighGainPerDose_Desc: The intensity of high gained per dose of this drug.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_HighFallPerDay_Desc: How much this drug's high will decay each day.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_HighDurationPerDose_Desc: How long this drug's high will last per dose.\n\nThis is calculated from the high gained per dose and the high fall rate.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_ToleranceGainPerDose_Des: How much a user's tolerance to the chemical will increase for each dose of this drug.\n\nThis can be different for different forms of the same chemical.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_ToleranceFallPerDay_Desc: How much a user's tolerance to the chemical will fall per day.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_MinToleranceForAddiction: The minimum tolerance required to become newly addicted to this drug.\n\nIf a user is below this tolerance level, they can't become newly addicted from taking a dose.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_SafeDoseInterval_Desc:
A user will never become addicted if they never take the drug more often than this.

This is calculated from the drug's minimum tolerance to addict, the tolerance gain per dose, and the rate of tolerance decay.

Note that some drugs don't have a safe interval. Such drugs can addict on any dose, even the first one.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_RandomODChance_Desc: The chance of a random overdose when taking this drug. Random overdoses can happen on any dose, whether it's a new user's first try or an experienced addict's hundredth hit.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_Addictiveness_Desc: The chance of addiction per dose of this drug.\n\nIf the drug has a minimum tolerance to addict, the tolerance must be above that level for this to apply. If there is no minimum tolerance, any dose can cause an addiction.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_AddictionSeverityInitial: New addictions caused by this drug begin at this severity level.\n\nTaking more of the drug will increase addiction severity, while time will reduce it.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_AddictionRecoveryTime_De: How long it takes to recover from an initial addiction to this drug.\n\nThis is be calculated from the new addiction severity divided by the rate of addiction recovery. An addiction which has been fed will take longer.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_AddictionSeverityPerDose: How much severity is added to an existing addiction for each dose of this drug.\n\nAddiction severity cannot go above 100%.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_AddictionNeedDoseInterva: How often an addict needs to take a dose of this drug to feed the addiction and prevent withdrawal.\n\nThis is calculated from the addiction need fall rate and the need fill per dose.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_AddictionNeedOffset_Desc: How much each dose of this drug fills an addict's need for the chemical.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_AddictionNeedFallRate_De: How quickly an addict's need for the chemical will fall.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_AddictionCost_Desc:
The market value of drugs that must be consumed per day to support an addiction to this drug without going into withdrawal.

This value is calculated from the addict's chemical need per dose, the need fall rate, and the market value of this drug.

Note that there may be other ways to get the same chemical with different costs.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_StyleDesc: An object's style determines its appearance. This has no gameplay effect. Styles often form the differing methods of construction used by people of different beliefs and cultures.
LanguageData.Stat_Animal_GestationTimeDesc: The time this species takes to gestate its offspring or eggs.
LanguageData.Stat_Animal_LitterSizeDesc: The number of offspring this creature creates per litter. If this is a range, any specific litter will have a random number of offspring in this range.
LanguageData.Stat_Animal_AdultMeatAmountDesc: The base amount of meat yielded by butchering an adult member of this species. The actual yield is affected by other factors such as damage to the body and butcher skill.
LanguageData.Stat_Animal_GrowthTimeDesc: How long it normally takes for this creature to reach adulthood. This time will be longer if the creature starves.
LanguageData.Stat_Animal_MeatPerDayDuringGrowthDesc: This creature gains this amount of meat for each day it grows, up until it reaches adulthood.\n\nThis value is calculated from the meat amount and growth time.
LanguageData.Stat_Animal_GrassToMaintainDesc: The typical number of grass plants that this creature needs in order to fulfill its dietary needs. This is based on normal grass at typical growth rates and ignores winter.
LanguageData.Stat_Animal_EggTypeDesc: The type of egg this creature lays.
LanguageData.Stat_Animal_EggsPerYearDesc: The number of eggs this creature will lay per year. Some creatures need to be fertilized to lay eggs. Egg laying will be slower if the creature starves.
LanguageData.Stat_Animal_EggNutritionDesc: The amount of nutrition in a single egg laid by this creature.
LanguageData.Stat_Animal_EggNutritionYearlyDesc: The amount of yearly nutrition generated by eggs laid by this creature each year.\n\nThis value is calculated from eggs per year and egg nutrition.
LanguageData.Stat_Animal_EggMarketValueDesc: The market value of a single laid egg.
LanguageData.Stat_Animal_EggMarketValueYearlyDesc: The total value of eggs normally laid over the course of a year.\n\nThis is calculated from eggs per year and egg market value.
LanguageData.Stat_Animal_MilkTypeDesc: The type of milk this creature produces.
LanguageData.Stat_Animal_MilkAmountDesc: The amount of milk this creature produces each time it is milked.
LanguageData.Stat_Animal_MilkGrowthTimeDesc: The amount of time this creature needs between milkings.
LanguageData.Stat_Animal_MilkPerYearDesc: The amount of milk produced by this animal over the course of a year.\n\nThis is calculated from milk amount and milking interval.
LanguageData.Stat_Animal_MilkValueDesc: The value of one unit of this creature's milk.
LanguageData.Stat_Animal_MilkValuePerYearDesc: The market value of one year's worth of milk from this creature, assuming it never goes hungry and is milked instantly at the end of each milk interval.\n\nThis is calculated from milk per year and milk market value.
LanguageData.Stat_Animal_WoolTypeDesc: The type of wool produced by this creature.
LanguageData.Stat_Animal_WoolAmountDesc: The amount of wool yielded by this creature each time it is shorn.
LanguageData.Stat_Animal_WoolGrowthTimeDesc: The time after shearing before this creature can be shorn again.
LanguageData.Stat_Animal_WoolPerYearDesc: The amount of wool produced by this creature per year.\n\nThis is calculated from wool amount and wool shearing interval.
LanguageData.Stat_Animal_WoolValueDesc: The market value of one unit of this creature's wool.
LanguageData.Stat_Animal_WoolValuePerYearDesc: The market value of one year's worth of wool from this creature.\n\nThis is calculated from wool amount per year and wool market value.
LanguageData.Stat_Studiable_Desc: How much of the total possible study you have performed on this object.
LanguageData.FactionGreetingHostile: {0} hurls some epithets into the microphone and disconnects.
LanguageData.FactionGreetingHostileAppreciative: {0} demands that you make a gesture of goodwill, like bringing gifts to one of {0_possessive} settlements or releasing {0_possessive} faction's prisoners unharmed. Until then, {0_pronoun} is unwilling to talk.\n\nMuttering an insult, {0_pronoun} disconnects.
LanguageData.FactionGreetingWary: {0} greets {NEGOTIATOR_labelShort} and asks what business you want to handle.
LanguageData.FactionGreetingWarm: {0} greets {NEGOTIATOR_labelShort} warmly and asks what {LEADER_pronoun} can do to help you.
LanguageData.ChooseTraderKind: {0} asks what kind of trade caravan you want.
LanguageData.TraderSent: {0} agrees to send you a trade caravan. It will arrive within a few days.
LanguageData.RequestAICoreInformation: Request the location of a {0} (cost: {1} silver)
LanguageData.RequestAICoreInformationResult: {0} sends the requested information and wishes you good luck.
LanguageData.MilitaryAidConfirmMutualEnemy: {0} will not help you fight other factions who are not their enemies. This includes some who are currently threatening you, {1}. Do you still want to call for aid?
LanguageData.MilitaryAidSent: {0} agrees to send fighters to help you.
LanguageData.CantSendMilitaryAidInTime: {0} apologizes and says they won't be able to arrive in time.\n\n(This faction's technology level is too low for transport pods)
LanguageData.CannotOrderNonControlledLower: cannot order characters you do not control
LanguageData.NoEmptyPlaceLower: no empty, accessible spot configured to store it
LanguageData.NoMergeTarget: no stack available to merge into
LanguageData.TheOnlyAvailableFoodIsInStorageOfHigherP: available food is in storage of higher priority
LanguageData.NoPrisonerBed: No reachable, un-reserved, enclosed prisoner-marked bed in safe temperature.
LanguageData.NoNonPrisonerBed: No reachable, un-reserved non-prisoner bed in safe temperature.
LanguageData.NoAnimalBed: No reachable, un-reserved animal bed in safe temperature.
LanguageData.CannotCarryToExit: Cannot carry {1_label} and leave the area
LanguageData.QuestRelated_Outfit: Cannot change outfits on temporary faction members
LanguageData.CannotPrioritizeResearch: Cannot prioritize: Research is a long-term task
LanguageData.LandInExistingMap: Zoom in and choose a landing spot in {0}
LanguageData.CommandForbiddenDesc: Forbidden: Your colonists are not allowed to interact with this. Click to allow.
LanguageData.CommandNotForbiddenDesc: Allowed: Your colonists are allowed to interact with this. Click to forbid.
LanguageData.CommandDesignateTogglePowerDesc: Designate this thing to have power toggled. A colonist will come soon to flick the switch.
LanguageData.CommandTryReconnectDesc: Try to connect to a different power net within my connection radius. This is useful if I'm connected to an unpowered net but there is a powered net nearby.
LanguageData.CommandGatherSpotToggleDescActive: Active - colonists will gather around this object.
LanguageData.CommandGatherSpotToggleDescInactive: Inactive - colonists will not gather around this object.
LanguageData.CommandToggleDraftDesc: Toggle military draft.\n\nDrafted people take orders and fight. They will not work, eat, or rest.
LanguageData.CommandFireAtWillDesc: Toggle fire at will.\n\nWhen disabled, this character will not automatically shoot at ranged targets. Does not affect melee combat.
LanguageData.CommandClearPrioritizedWorkDesc: Clear any prioritized work you assigned. The character will go back to their usual self-directed activities.
LanguageData.CommandBedSetOwnerDesc: Assign this bed to be owned by a specific colonist.
LanguageData.CommandThroneSetOwnerDesc: Assign this throne to be owned by a specific colonist.
LanguageData.CommandMeditationSpotSetOwnerDesc: Assign this meditation spot to be owned by a specific colonist.
LanguageData.CommandGraveAssignColonistDesc: Assign this grave to be owned by a specific colonist.
LanguageData.CommandBedSetForPrisonersDesc: Whether beds in this room should be used by prisoners.
LanguageData.CommandBedSetForPrisonersFailOutdoors: Only beds in enclosed spaces can be set for prisoners.
LanguageData.CommandBedSetAsMedicalDesc: Whether this bed is for medical use.
LanguageData.TurningOnPrisonerBedWarning: Turning on prisoner mode affects the whole room (since prisoners and colonists cannot sleep in the same room).\n\nThese people will lose ownership of their beds:
LanguageData.TurningOffPrisonerBedWarning: Turning off prisoner mode affects the whole room (since prisoners and colonists cannot sleep in the same room).\n\nThese people will lose ownership of their beds:
LanguageData.AreYouSure: Are you sure you want to do this?
LanguageData.ChangingOwnerTypeBedWarning: Changing bed use affects the whole room (since prisoners, slaves and colonists cannot sleep in the same room).\n\nThese people will lose ownership of their beds:
LanguageData.CommandCopyZoneSettingsDesc: Copy this zone's settings to the clipboard so you can paste them onto another zone.
LanguageData.CommandPasteZoneSettingsDesc: Overwrite this zone's settings with those previously copied to the clipboard.
LanguageData.CommandAllowSowDesc: When disabled, colonists will never sow new plants in this zone. They will still harvest.
LanguageData.CommandAllowCutDesc: When disabled, colonists will never cut plants in this zone. They will still sow new plants in spaces that are already empty, and harvest.
LanguageData.CommandSetForceAttackTargetDesc: Sets a target that this turret must attack continuously as long as it can.
LanguageData.CommandStopForceAttackDesc: Stops force-attacking and allows the turret to fire as it wishes.
LanguageData.CommandExtractShellDesc: Unloads the current shell so it can be replaced with different ammunition.
LanguageData.MessageTurretWontFireBecauseHoldFire: Warning: The mortar won't fire because it's set to "Hold fire".
LanguageData.CommandShipLaunchDesc: Start the ship launch sequence with the current configuration.
LanguageData.CommandShipLaunchReportDesc: Show a readiness report about the ship's launch capability.
LanguageData.CommandPodEjectDesc: Wake up the cryptosleeper and eject them.
LanguageData.CommandToggleDoorForbidDesc: When a door is forbidden, colonists and allies will not go through it. This doesn't affect how enemies or animals interact with the door.
LanguageData.CommandToggleDoorHoldOpenDesc: When active, your colonists will not close the door after passing through.
LanguageData.CommandResetTempDesc: Reset the target temperature to room temperature.
LanguageData.CommandInstallDesc: This item is currently packaged up for storage and transport. Use this command to install this item in a final location.
LanguageData.CommandReinstallDesc: Designate this item to be uninstalled and reinstalled somewhere else.
LanguageData.CommandMakeBeaconStockpileDesc: Create a stockpile around this building exactly matching the shape of the beacon's launch radius.
LanguageData.CommandSunLampMakeGrowingZoneDesc: Create a growing zone around this building exactly matching the shape of the lamp's light radius.
LanguageData.CommandAutoRearmDesc: If this is on, this trap will automatically be replaced after it springs.
LanguageData.CommandReleaseAnimalsDesc: While this is on, mastered animals are sent forth to attack distant targets. While it is off, they remain near and guard the master.
LanguageData.CommandSquadAttackDesc: Order selected colonists to attack designated target.
LanguageData.CommandMeleeAttackDesc: Order selected colonists to attack designated target using only fists and melee weapons.
LanguageData.CommandSelectPlantToGrowDesc: Determine which plant should be sown here.
LanguageData.CommandBuildCopyDesc: Build a copy of this building.
LanguageData.CommandFormCaravanDesc: Form a group of colonists able to travel to new areas. The colonists will gather all the assigned supplies and accompanying animals, leave their current area, and await further orders.
LanguageData.CommandReformCaravanDesc: Reform a group of colonists. The colonists will leave their current area and await further orders.
LanguageData.CommandReformCaravanFailHostilePawns: There are still some enemies in this area.
LanguageData.CommandSplitCaravanDesc: Split this caravan into two. The caravans can be later merged back into one as long as they are close to each other.
LanguageData.CommandMergeCaravansFailCaravansNotSelec: Select all caravans which should be merged. The caravans must be close to each other.
LanguageData.CommandSettleDesc: Settle in this area. Your colonists will enter this area and you will be able to start building a new home.
LanguageData.CommandSettleFailAlreadyHaveBase: Your faction can only have one base.
LanguageData.CommandSettleFailNoColonists: There isn't anybody there to claim the area.
LanguageData.CommandSettleFailEnemies: There are enemies in this area.
LanguageData.CommandAbandonHomeDesc: Abandon this area. The area will become inaccessible and you will not be able to return here ever again. After abandoning your home, you will be able to order one of your caravans to settle in a new area.
LanguageData.CommandAbandonHomeFailAllColonistsThere: All of your colonists are there.
LanguageData.CommandRemoveFromCaravanDesc: Remove this person or animal from the caravan.
LanguageData.CommandAddToCaravanDesc: Add this person or animal to the forming caravan.
LanguageData.CommandTradeFailNoNegotiator: There isn't any conscious and capable negotiator.
LanguageData.CommandTradeFailNeedPermit: None of your people have the required faction permission: {0}
LanguageData.CommandFulfillTradeOfferDesc: Fulfill the settlement's request for goods and claim your reward.
LanguageData.CommandFulfillTradeOfferFailInsufficient: Your caravan must have {0} to fulfill this trade offer.
LanguageData.CommandTakeOffDesc: Get on board the ship and escape the planet.
LanguageData.CommandTakeOffConfirmation: Are you sure you want to launch the ship?\n\nEveryone in this area will escape the planet. Everyone else will be left behind.
LanguageData.CommandSetTargetFuelLevelDesc: Set the target fuel level. Colonists will attempt to fill this up to the target fuel level.
LanguageData.CommandToggleAllowAutoRefuelDesc: Sets whether or not automatic refueling is allowed.
LanguageData.CommandCancelLoadDesc: Cancel loading this with people or items and eject everything already loaded.
LanguageData.CommandLaunchGroupDesc: Take off and fly to a destination.
LanguageData.CommandLaunchGroupFailNotConnectedToFuel: Some transport pods in this loading group are not connected to a fueling port.
LanguageData.CommandLaunchGroupFailNoFuel: Some pod launchers in this group have no fuel.
LanguageData.CommandLaunchGroupFailUnderRoof: Some pod launchers are under a roof.
LanguageData.CommandLoadTransporterDesc: Defines the selected transporter(s) as a launch group. Opens the loading dialog so you can decide who and what should be loaded inside.
LanguageData.CommandLoadTransporterFailNotConnectedTo: The transport pod is not connected to a fueling port.
LanguageData.CommandLoadTransporterFailNoFuel: The pod launcher has no fuel.
LanguageData.CommandLoadTransporterSingleDesc: Opens the loading dialog so you can decide who and what should be loaded inside.
LanguageData.CommandSetToLoadTransporterDesc: Opens the loading dialog so you can decide who and what should be loaded inside.
LanguageData.CommandAutoloadTransportersDesc: Toggle loading all required cargo automatically as soon as they become available.
LanguageData.CommandSelectPreviousTransporterDesc: Select previous transport pod in this launch group.
LanguageData.CommandSelectAllTransportersDesc: Select all transport pods in this launch group.
LanguageData.CommandSelectNextTransporterDesc: Select next transport pod in this launch group.
LanguageData.CommandDesignateOpenCloseVentDesc: Designate this vent to be opened or closed. A colonist will come soon to perform the task.
LanguageData.CommandToggleCaravanPauseDesc:
Start resting. This has the following benefits:

 - People can interact socially
 - Forage for food {0} times faster
 - Visibility multiplied by {1}
LanguageData.CommandShowSellableItemsDesc: Show everything this trader wants to buy.
LanguageData.CommandSendShuttleDesc: Initiate takeoff and have the shuttle fly to its destination.
LanguageData.CommandSendShuttleFailUnderRoof: The shuttle is under a roof.
LanguageData.CommandSendShuttleFailMissingRequiredThi: Some of the required items or people are missing.
LanguageData.CommandShuttleDismissDesc: Unload all contents and send the shuttle away.
LanguageData.CommandPlaceBlueprintsDesc: Place all required blueprints where possible.
LanguageData.CommandViewQuestDesc: View this quest in quests tab.
LanguageData.CommandOpenLinkedQuestDesc: Open linked quest in the quests tab.
LanguageData.TakeDrugDesc: Choose a drug from inventory to ingest immediately.
LanguageData.CommandLeaveRitualDesc: Stop participating in the {RITUAL_labelDef}. The ritual will continue as long as it has at least one participant.
LanguageData.CommandLeaveLastParticipant: This is the last participant in the {RITUAL_labelDef}.
LanguageData.CommandCancelRitualDesc: End the {RITUAL_labelDef} immediately. Ritual obligation will remain. You can restart the ritual later.
LanguageData.CommandCancelRitualConfirm: Are you sure you want to cancel {RITUAL_labelDef}?
LanguageData.ClauseSequence8: {0} and {1}. Also, {2} and {3}. {4} and {5}. Finally, {6} and {7}.
LanguageData.AnimalInsanitySingle: A local {ANIMAL_label} has gone mad. It will attack everyone it sees.
LanguageData.AnimalInsanityMultiple: Some sort of psychic wave has swept over the landscape. Your colonists are okay, but...\n\nIt seems many of the {0} in the area have been driven insane.
LanguageData.LetterCropBlight: Blight has been discovered on the {PLANTDEF_labelPlural}! \nYou should cut or burn the affected plants before the blight spreads.
LanguageData.EnemyRaidLeaderPresent: One of the {LEADER_factionPawnsPlural} - {LEADER_labelShort}, is the leader of the faction.
LanguageData.FriendlyRaidLeaderPresent: One of the {LEADER_factionPawnsPlural} - {LEADER_labelShort}, is the leader of the faction.
LanguageData.RefugeePodCrash: {PAWN_titleIndef} named {PAWN_nameDef} is crashing in a transport pod nearby. If {PAWN_pronoun} survives the impact, {PAWN_pronoun} will be badly wounded.
LanguageData.RefugeePodCrash_Factionless: {PAWN_nameDef} is not affiliated with any faction. You can rescue {PAWN_objective} and hope {PAWN_pronoun} joins freely, or capture {PAWN_objective} for recruitment or slavery purposes.
LanguageData.RefugeePodCrash_Hostile: {PAWN_nameDef} is from your enemy {PAWN_factionName}. You can capture {PAWN_objective} for recruitment or slavery purposes.
LanguageData.RefugeePodCrash_NonHostile: {PAWN_nameDef} is from {PAWN_factionName}. If you rescue {PAWN_objective}, {PAWN_pronoun} may join freely. Otherwise, {PAWN_pronoun} will return home and spread goodwill between your factions.\n\nYou can also capture {PAWN_objective} for recruitment or slavery purposes, but this will anger {PAWN_possessive} faction.
LanguageData.LetterWandererJoins: A {PAWN_title} named {PAWN_nameDef} has arrived and wants to join the colony.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] is willing to contribute, but will not leave voluntarily, claiming to have nowhere else to go. You can choose to turn {PAWN_objective} down and send {PAWN_objective} away. However, your colonists will be disturbed at sending someone away in need.
LanguageData.CargoPodCrash: You have detected a cluster of cargo pods crashing nearby.\n\nPerhaps you'll find something useful in the wreckage.
LanguageData.ShortCircuit: A fault in {0} has caused a short circuit.
LanguageData.ShortCircuitStartedFire: A fault in {0} has caused a short circuit which started a fire.
LanguageData.ShortCircuitDischargedEnergy: All {0} Wd of energy in the connected batteries has been discharged in an electrical explosion.
LanguageData.ShortCircuitWasLarge: This large amount of power has created an explosion of considerable size.
LanguageData.ShortCircuitWasHuge: That really is a huge explosion. Wow.
LanguageData.TraderArrivalNoFaction: They are not affiliated with any faction.
LanguageData.SingleTravelerPassing: A {PAWN_title} from {1} is passing by. {PAWN_pronoun} is named {PAWN_nameFull}.
LanguageData.GroupTravelersPassing: A group of travelers from {0} are passing by.
LanguageData.SingleVisitorArrives: {PAWN_titleIndef} from {1} is visiting the colony.\n\n{PAWN_pronoun} is named {PAWN_nameFull}.{3}{4}
LanguageData.SingleVisitorArrivesTraderInfo: {PAWN_pronoun} seems to have a few items to trade.
LanguageData.SingleVisitorArrivesLeaderInfo: {PAWN_pronoun} is the leader of the faction.
LanguageData.GroupVisitorsArrive: A group from {0} are visiting the colony.{1}{2}
LanguageData.GroupVisitorsArriveTraderInfo: They seem to have a few items to trade.
LanguageData.GroupVisitorsArriveLeaderInfo: One of the visitors - {1_labelShort}, is the leader of the faction.
LanguageData.ManhunterPackArrived:
A pack of man-hunting {0} have entered the area! Driven insane by the disease known as scaria, they will roam the region, hunting for humanoid flesh.

They won't attack doors unless they see someone go through the door. Hide inside and you'll be safe. They also won't attack powered-off turrets, so turn your turrets off to save them.

The {0} will leave the area in one or two days. You can hide and wait them out, or fight them.
LanguageData.MessageAnimalInsanityPulse: The {SOURCE_label} has emitted a psychic pulse that has driven nearby animals mad.
LanguageData.LetterShipPartDroveColonistInsane: The crashed ship part has emitted a focused psychic pulse that has driven colonist {0} insane.
LanguageData.LetterPsychicDroneLevelIncreased: The crashed ship part is now emanating a more powerful kind of psychic drone. Every {0} humanlike in the area now feels more disturbed, terrified, and paranoid.
LanguageData.LetterAgentRevealed: {0} has been revealed as an agent of your enemy {1}.\n\nThey are attempting to escape now.
LanguageData.BeaversArrived: A group of hungry alphabeavers has just arrived.\n\nTry to eliminate them before they decimate every last source of wood in the region.
LanguageData.LetterAnimalSelfTameAndNameNumerical: {0} has become tame. It is now designated {ANIMAL_nameFull}.
LanguageData.LetterAnimalSelfTameAndName: {0} has become tame. Colonists have decided to name it {ANIMAL_nameFull}.
LanguageData.LetterFarmAnimalsWanderIn: A group of {0}, abandoned or lost, have wandered into the area.\n\nThey seem accustomed to human contact and are joining the colony.
LanguageData.LetterThrumboPasses:
A small herd of thrumbos have wandered into the area.

Peaceful by nature, these rare creatures are extremely dangerous when confronted. Some traders are willing to pay a lot of money for their precious leather and horn.

Thrumbos will leave the area in a few days.
LanguageData.LetterTraderCaravanArrival: A caravan from {0} is approaching. They are a {1}.
LanguageData.LetterCaravanArrivalCommonWarning: They will hang around the colony for some time before leaving. You can attack them - but this will anger their faction!
LanguageData.RansomDemand: {1} contacts you on radio. They are holding former colonist {PAWN_labelShort} for ransom.\n\nThey're willing to release {PAWN_objective} back to you in exchange for {2} silver.
LanguageData.EscapeShipFound:
You've reached the coordinates sent by (*Name)Charlon Whitestone(/Name) and discovered the hidden starship.

The ship's reactor is still in deep hibernation mode, so it can't fly yet. You can start it up by interacting with the computer core.

(*Name)Charlon Whitestone(/Name) warns you that the startup process will take about 15 days, and the energy signature will be detectable from a long distance away. This sort of energy signature indicates interstellar flight capability, and will attract gangs of desperate raiders and swarms of deadly mechanoids.

You will be assaulted with an intensity you've never seen. Make sure your defenses are prepared first.
LanguageData.EscapeShipFoundPeaceful:
You've reached the coordinates sent by (*Name)Charlon Whitestone(/Name) and discovered the hidden starship.

The ship's reactor is still in deep hibernation mode, so it can't fly yet. You can start it up by interacting with the computer core.

(*Name)Charlon Whitestone(/Name) warns you that the startup process will take about 15 days.
LanguageData.EscapeShipLost:
(*Name)Charlon Whitestone(/Name) sends you a message.

He sees that you've lost control of the landed ship. To stop it falling into the wrong hands, he's been forced to trigger the ship's self-destruct mechanism. The ship is now a crater.

You'll need to find another way off this planet.
LanguageData.CaravanMeeting: {0} has met peacefully with a caravan from {1}. The other caravan is composed of:\n\n{2}
LanguageData.CaravanMeeting_TradeIncapable: no caravan members capable of trading
LanguageData.CaravanMeeting_NoPermit: need a trader with the title of {0} from {1_name}
LanguageData.LetterCaravanRequest:
A nearby settlement, {0}, contacts you with a special trade request. They would like to purchase:

 {1} (worth {2})

In return, they offer:

 {3} (worth {4})

This request expires after: {5}

If you want to make the trade, send a caravan with the requested supplies. The estimated travel time is {6}. You can review this offer by selecting {0} on the world map.
LanguageData.CaravanDemand: {0} has been ambushed by a group of {2} {4} from {1}. They will attack unless you give them:\n\n{3}
LanguageData.LetterSiteNoLongerHostile: Because you are no longer hostile with {0}, the {1} site is no longer available.
LanguageData.LetterSiteNoLongerHostileMulti: Because you are no longer hostile with {0}, the following sites are no longer available
LanguageData.LetterQuestAskerFactionHostile: The quest is now incompletable because {FACTION_name} is hostile.
LanguageData.LetterQuestAskerCaptured: The quest is now incompletable because {SUBJECT_definite} has been captured.
LanguageData.LetterQuestAskerDied: The quest is now incompletable because {SUBJECT_definite} has died.
LanguageData.RecipeRequiresSkills: The recipe {0} requires the skills below. None of your colonists have these skills, so nobody will do this bill.
LanguageData.ClipboardBillNotAvailableHere: Copied bill cannot be pasted here
LanguageData.RecruitmentResistanceDesc: How much doubt this prisoner has about joining your faction. When this reaches zero, they can be recruited.
LanguageData.PrisonerReleaseRelationGainsDesc: The faction goodwill you will get from the prisoner's faction if you release them. This is affected by the prisoner's identity, health, and mental condition.
LanguageData.PrisonBreakMTBDaysDescription: The average days awake between prison breaks. This is affected by mood, mobility, the number of prison doors, and time since the last prison break.\n\nNote that this does not include time spent asleep.
LanguageData.SlavePriceDescription: The base market value of this {0} if sold.
LanguageData.SelfTendTip: {0} with self-tend enabled will automatically tend to themselves on the spot at {1} the normal efficiency.
LanguageData.CannotTrainTooSmall: {1_labelShort} is too small to train this.
LanguageData.ConfirmRemoveItemDialog: Do you really want to remove {0}?
LanguageData.DismissQuest: Dismiss this quest and move it to the historical tab.\n\nThe quest can be un-dismissed at any time. Its effects and expiry times will proceed as normal. You won't recieve notifications about dismissed quests.
LanguageData.UnDismissQuest: Un-dismiss this quest.\n\nThe quest will be returned to the available or active tab, and notifications will be re-enabled.
LanguageData.QuestDismissed: This quest is here because it was dismissed.\n\nYou can un-dismiss it until it expires.
LanguageData.DeleteQuest: Delete this quest and remove it from the quest list forever.
LanguageData.PenFoodTab_NotEnclosed: enclose the pen marker to calculate food information
LanguageData.PenFoodTab_StockpileTotalDescription: The total nutrition of stockpiled food in the pen.
LanguageData.PenFoodTab_StockpileEmptyDaysDescription: Nutrition consumption exceeds nutrition growth rate in this pen. The animals will eventually eat all the stockpiled food and starve.
LanguageData.PenFoodTab_NaturalNutritionGrowthRateDes: The average nutrition provided by edible plants in this pen.
LanguageData.PenFoodTab_NutritionConsumptionDescripti: The nutrition needed by animals currently in this pen.\n\nTo get more food, expand the pen to cover more wild plant growth, or deliver stockpiled food like haygrass to the pen.
LanguageData.PenFoodTab_NaturalNutritionGrowthRateSea: Note: Plant growth rate varies due to seasons, weather, theft by wild animals, and other factors. These calculations are approximations.
LanguageData.PenFoodTab_NutritionConsumedPerDay_Colum: The total nutrition that will be consumed each day by each type of animal in this pen.
LanguageData.PenFoodTab_AnimalTypeAnimalCapacity: Count that could be supported with no other animals in the pen
LanguageData.PenAutoCut_EnabledCheckboxTip:
Automatically mark certain inedible plants to be cut. This makes room for edible plants to grow, which your animals can then eat.

This auto-designation happens periodically and only applies to certain plants.

This only works when the pen is enclosed.
