LanguageData.AutocutUnenclosedPenTip: Pen is not enclosed now, so auto-cut wont occur.
LanguageData.FirstSummerWarning:
Summer has begun! But winter is coming.

Your food crops won't grow in the winter cold. Be sure to store enough food to survive. You can build a walk-in refrigerator to prevent food from spoiling.

Buy, steal, or make some parkas, or you'll freeze when you step outside.
LanguageData.LetterRelationsChange_Hostile: Relations with {0} have broken down completely. They are now hostile to you.
LanguageData.LetterRelationsChange_HostileGoodwillDes: They will conduct periodic raids on your colony and caravans, and refuse to trade with you. If you want to improve relations, you can still offer them gifts using caravans or transport pods.\n\nThis happened because goodwill ({0}) has fallen below {1}. In order to restore neutral relations, goodwill must reach {2} again.
LanguageData.LetterRelationsChange_NeutralFromHostile: Relations with {0} have warmed. They now consider you neutral and will no longer attack you.
This happened because goodwill ({1}) has risen past {2}. If goodwill falls below {3}, {0} will become hostile again. If goodwill rises above {4}, they will become your ally and fight for you.
LanguageData.LetterRelationsChange_NeutralFromAlly: Relations with {0} have cooled. They now consider you neutral instead of allied.
LanguageData.LetterRelationsChange_NeutralFromAllyGoo: While they will still interact peacefully with you, they will no longer send fighters to help you when you are under threat.\n\nThis happened because goodwill ({1}) has fallen below {2}. If goodwill falls below {3}, {0} will become hostile. If goodwill rises above {4}, they will become allied once again.
LanguageData.LetterRelationsChange_Ally: Relations with {0} have become very close. They now consider you an ally.
LanguageData.LetterRelationsChange_AllyGoodwillDescri: Allies will sometimes arrive to help fight your enemies when you are under attack. You can also call them for help at any time, at a cost of goodwill.\n\nYou've become allies because your goodwill ({0}) has risen past {1}. If goodwill falls below {2}, relations will return to neutral.
LanguageData.ShortCircuitRain: A {1_label} has short-circuited in the rain and started a fire.
LanguageData.AreaRevealed: A new area has been revealed.
LanguageData.AreaRevealedWithMechanoids: A new area has been revealed. It contains ancient, hostile mechanoids.
LanguageData.RoofCollapsed: A roof has collapsed because it was too far from any support.
LanguageData.RelatedPawnInvolvedInQuest: {PAWN_nameDef} is {RELATIVE_labelShort}'s {1}. If {PAWN_nameDef} dies, {RELATIVE_labelShort} will suffer from long-lasting grief. However, if you manage to rescue {PAWN_nameDef}, {RELATIVE_labelShort} will be very happy for a long time.
LanguageData.BirthdayChronological:
It's {0}'s chronological birthday today! Biologically, {1} is {3} years old.

Chronologically, {1} just turned {2}.

Note that since people don't age while in cryptosleep, chronological birthday is separate from biological birthday.
LanguageData.NewDisease: {PAWN} has gotten sick from {1}.\n\nEnsure you have a medical bed and a doctor. Make sure that {PAWN_definite} gets proper treatment and spends as much time in bed as possible.
LanguageData.NewPartDisease: {PAWN} has gotten sick from {3}. The infection is in {PAWN_possessive} {1}.\n\nEnsure you have a medical bed and a doctor. Make sure that {PAWN_definite} gets proper treatment and spends as much time in bed as possible.
LanguageData.PawnWasFormerlyColonist: {0} was formerly part of your faction.
LanguageData.PawnHasTheseRelationshipsWithColonists: {1_labelShort} has these relationships with your colonists:
LanguageData.AncientShrineWarning: As {PAWN_nameDef} draws near the ancient wall, a sense of foreboding overcomes {PAWN_objective}. {PAWN_pronoun} isn't sure why, but {PAWN_pronoun} feels that this dusty structure may contain great danger.
LanguageData.AnimalManhunterFromDamage: {1_indefinite} is attacking after being harmed!\n\nIt will hunt any humanoid it can reach. It will calm down when it goes to sleep.
LanguageData.AnimalManhunterFromTaming: {1_indefinite} is attacking due to a botched taming attempt!
LanguageData.AnimalManhunterOthers: Other {1_kindBasePlural} nearby have also become enraged!
LanguageData.LetterFriendlyTrapSprung: {1_labelShort} has accidentally sprung a trap and taken damage from it.
LanguageData.MentalStateReason_Mood: This happened because of poor mood.
LanguageData.MentalStateReason_Trait: This happened because of the trait: {0}.
LanguageData.LetterInspirationBeginThanksToHighMoodPa: Thanks to high mood, [PAWN_nameIndef] has experienced an inspiration!
LanguageData.LetterRelatedPawnsRaidEnemy:
There are people who have relationships with your {0} or prisoners in the arriving group of {1}.

Keep in mind that even though they are related, they will still attack each other because of their bad factions relations.

These people are:
LanguageData.LetterRelatedPawnsRaidFriendly: There are people who have relationships with your {0} or prisoners in the arriving group of friendly {1}:
LanguageData.LetterRelatedPawnsNeutralGroup: There are people who have relationships with your {0} or prisoners in the arriving group:
LanguageData.LetterRelatedPawnsTradeShip: The orbital trader is selling people who have relationships with your {0} or prisoners:
LanguageData.LetterRelatedPawnsTradingWithSettlement: The settlement is selling people who have relationships with your {0} or prisoners:
LanguageData.LetterRelatedPawnsTradingWithOtherCarava: The caravan is selling people who have relationships with your {0} or prisoners:
LanguageData.LetterRelatedPawnsGroupGeneric: There are people who have relationships with your {0} or prisoners in the group:
LanguageData.LetterRelatedPawnsInMapWherePlayerLanded: There are people who have relationships with your {0} or prisoners in the area where your {0} have landed.
LanguageData.LetterRelatedPawnsSettlement: There are people who have relationships with your {0} or prisoners in this settlement:
LanguageData.LetterRelatedPawnsSite: There are people who have relationships with your {0} or prisoners in this area:
LanguageData.RelationshipAppendedLetterTextColonist: {PAWN_nameDef} has a relationship with a colonist. {PAWN_pronoun} is {RELATIVE_labelShort}'s {1}.
LanguageData.RelationshipAppendedLetterTextPrisoner: {PAWN_nameDef} has a relationship with one of your prisoners. {PAWN_pronoun} is {RELATIVE_labelShort}'s {1}.
LanguageData.LetterAffair: {PAWN1_labelShort}, married to {SPOUSE_labelShort}, has begun an affair with {PAWN2_labelShort}.
LanguageData.LetterNewLovers: {PAWN1_labelShort} and {PAWN2_labelShort} now want to sleep together. Consider assigning them a double bed.
LanguageData.LetterNoLongerLovers: {PAWN1_labelShort} and {PAWN2_labelShort} are no longer in a relationship.
LanguageData.LetterNoLongerLovers_BackToBirthName: {PAWN_labelShort} will change {PAWN_possessive} last name back to {PAWN_possessive} birth name.
LanguageData.LetterAcceptedProposal: At some point in the coming days or quadrums, they will have their marriage ceremony and invite all the colonists. Consider placing a marriage spot if you want to control where the ceremony occurs.
LanguageData.LetterRejectedProposal: {INITIATOR_nameFull} is going to be unhappy about this.
LanguageData.LetterPartBondedAnimalDied: {ANIMAL_definite} was bonded to {HUMAN_labelShort}. It will affect {HUMAN_labelShort}'s mood.
LanguageData.LetterPartBondedAnimalDiedMulti: It will affect mood of the following people:\n\n{0}
LanguageData.LetterNewlyAddicted: {PAWN_labelShort} has developed an addiction to {1}.\n\n{PAWN_pronoun} now has a need for {1}, visible on {PAWN_possessive} Needs tab. {PAWN_pronoun} will automatically consume the drug to fulfil {PAWN_possessive} need. If {PAWN_pronoun} cannot get any {1}, {PAWN_pronoun} will go into withdrawal.
LanguageData.LetterCaravanEnteredEnemyBase: {0} has arrived at {1} and is ready to begin the attack.
LanguageData.LetterTransportPodsLandedInEnemyBase: Your transport pods have arrived at {0}.
LanguageData.LetterFactionBaseDefeated: The enemy settlement {0} has been destroyed.\n\nIn {1}, your caravan will be attacked by enemies. They will begin sending forces to attack the caravan, unless it reforms and leaves.
LanguageData.LetterFactionBaseDefeated_FactionDestroy: Since this was their last settlement, {0} has been defeated.
LanguageData.LetterDefeatAllEnemiesQuestCompleted: You have defeated the enemy outpost!\n\nThe payment from {0} has arrived, and faction relations have improved by {1}.
LanguageData.LetterFoundPreciousLump:
Using your long-range mineral scanner, {WORKER_labelShort} has found a lump of {0} some distance away.

Unfortunately, it won't last - others will mine it first in {1} days if we don't.

{2}.
LanguageData.LetterDeepScannerFoundLump: {FINDER_nameDef} has found a lump of buried {0} using the ground-penetrating scanner!
LanguageData.LetterPeaceTalks_Disaster:
The talks were a disaster. The delegates barely got past their initial greetings before the discussion broke down into insults and recriminations.

After your caravan departed early, {0} from {1} caught up with it and attacked!

Relations with {1}: {2}.
LanguageData.LetterPeaceTalks_Backfire: The talks have backfired. Despite trading some pleasantries, the delegates made no progress on substantive issues, and multiple statements were interpreted as insults.\n\nRelations with {0}: {1}.
LanguageData.LetterPeaceTalks_TalksFlounder: The talks floundered. Delegates managed to communicate clearly and with basic respect, but were not able to make progress on any genuine issues.\n\nRelations with {0} remain unchanged.
LanguageData.LetterPeaceTalks_Success: The talks were a success. The delegates reached new mutual understanding on several substantial issues.\n\nRelations with {0} have improved by {1}.
LanguageData.LetterPeaceTalks_Triumph:
The talks were a great triumph! Delegates connected quickly on a personal level and came to truly see each others' perspective on the most difficult issues of the day.

Relations with {0} have improved by {1}.

As your caravan departed, {0} offered you a gift:

{2}
LanguageData.PeaceTalksSocialXPGain: {PAWN_labelShort}, your negotiator, has gained {1} social experience.
LanguageData.LetterRunWildMentalBreak:
{0} is fed up with civilization.

{PAWN_pronoun} realized that wild creatures are always free. So, {PAWN_pronoun} has decided to leave your faction and live with the animals.

You can attempt to tame or arrest {PAWN_objective} to get {PAWN_objective} back.
LanguageData.LetterCatatonicMentalBreak: {0} has suffered a total mental breakdown and entered a catatonic state. {PAWN_pronoun} will recover in several days.
LanguageData.LetterAICoreOffer: {PAWN_definite} of {1} contacts you with an offer of information: the location of a persona core, which you'll need in order to build a spaceship. They inform you that this item is quite rare and usually its owners have it under heavy guard.\n\nCall them with your comms console if you're interested.
LanguageData.LetterCraftedLegendaryMessage: {WORKER_labelShort} has created a {CRAFTED_labelShort}.\n\nNews of this valuable artifact will spread across the world.
LanguageData.LetterPawnsLostBecauseMapClosed_Caravan: Your caravan has been lost. The following people and animals have been lost with it
LanguageData.LetterPawnsLostBecauseMapClosed_Home: The following people and animals have been abandoned
LanguageData.LetterHibernateComplete: (*Name)Charlon Whitestone(/Name) has finished the reactor's hibernation recovery sequence. The reactor is now ready to power a liftoff.
LanguageData.LetterHibernateCompleteStandalone: The reactor's power up sequence is complete. It is now ready to power a liftoff.
LanguageData.LetterFactionBaseProximity: Because you are so close to other factions, they feel you're encroaching on their territory.\n\nFor the last quadrum, faction relations have been reduced by:
LanguageData.LetterCaravansBattlefieldVictory:
Your caravan has won the battle.

You can reform the caravan now in the World screen by selecting the battlefield and choosing the "Reform caravan" option.

There's no need to collect items manually, the reform caravan tool can do it instantly.

In {0}, your caravan will be attacked by enemies. They will begin sending forces to attack the caravan, unless it reforms and leaves.
LanguageData.LetterRescueQuestFinished: You have rescued {PAWN_nameDef} and {PAWN_pronoun} has joined your group.\n\nYou can take {PAWN_objective} with you by reforming the caravan in the World screen by selecting this area and choosing the "Reform caravan" option.
LanguageData.LetterTraitDisease: {PAWN_label} has gotten sick from {1}.\n\nEnsure you have a medical bed and a doctor. Make sure that {PAWN_pronoun} gets proper treatment and spends as much time in bed as possible.
LanguageData.MessageMedicalOperationFailureMinor: {SURGEON_labelShort} has failed in a minor way while operating on {PATIENT_labelShort} ({RECIPE_label}).
LanguageData.MessageMedicalOperationFailureCatastroph: {SURGEON_labelShort} has failed catastrophically while operating on {PATIENT_labelShort} ({RECIPE_label}).
LanguageData.MessageMedicalOperationFailureRidiculous: {SURGEON_labelShort} has failed in a ridiculous way while operating on {PATIENT_labelShort} ({RECIPE_label}).
LanguageData.MessageMedicalOperationFailureFatal: {SURGEON_labelShort} has committed a fatal error while operating on {PATIENT_labelShort} because of the special challenges of: {2}.
LanguageData.LetterQuestBecameAvailable: A new quest has become available. It is called '{0}'.
LanguageData.LetterQuestRequiresAcceptance: If you don't accept the quest within {0}, it will expire.
LanguageData.LetterQuestBecameActive: A new quest has become active. It is called '{0}'.

LanguageData.GoodwillTip:
Your goodwill with {0_name} will improve by {1}.

Current goodwill: {4} ({5}).

Goodwill measures the general relationship between factions. If it falls below {2}, the faction becomes hostile and will raid your settlements and caravans. If it rises above {3}, the faction will become your ally and send fighters to help you when they can. Otherwise, the faction remains neutral and will trade and talk with you freely.

LanguageData.DevBuildWarning:
Warning: This is an unstable development build. This means we are running design experiments and doing technical development.

Some things will be temporarily unbalanced on purpose. This is a classic game design method where we deliberately go too far with a balance change in order to better understand balance boundaries. We can then use that information to decide on the final balance points.

There will also be bugs, including game-breaking ones. Save compatibility may break any time.

If you're okay with all of this, thanks for testing! If you don't want to be subject to our experiments, please play the latest stable version.
LanguageData.PlanetCoverageTip: The planet is always the same diameter, but since it's far larger than needed for play, we don't generate the whole surface because it can take a very long time. This is the percentage of the surface that you want generated.

LanguageData.MessageModNeedsWellFormattedPackageId:
Mod needs a unique, properly formatted packageId in About.xml. It must must meet following requirements:

 - Alphanumeric characters and dot only.
 - No spaces.
 - At least one dot.
 - No repeated dots in a row, or starting or ending with a dot.
 - 60 characters or less.
 - Cannot contain word "Ludeon".

For example:
<packageId>AuthorName.ModName</packageId>
<packageId>AuthorName.ModName.Specific</packageId>

LanguageData.HowStorytellersWork: The AI Storyteller creates events like pirate raids, resource drops, or animal attacks. Their choices will affect the story of your colony. You can change these settings at any time.
LanguageData.MustChoosePermadeath: Please choose commitment mode or reload anytime mode.
LanguageData.ReloadAnytimeModeInfo: You can save and load the game at any time.\n\nThis is a good choice if you're still learning the game, if it fits your personal playstyle, if you're using mods that may break your game, or if you intend to self-enforce commitment mode.
LanguageData.PermadeathModeInfo:
You can only save when quitting the game.

Since RimWorld is a story generator, even losing all but one person is not the end of the game - it's part of the story. The game is designed to allow recovery after losses.

Playing out these terrible situations makes a story with both tragedy and triumph. It's the way RimWorld was designed to be played.

There's a reason Luke Skywalker didn't quit and reload when his family got killed - loss and recovery is dramatic.
LanguageData.CanChangeStorytellerSettingsDuringPlay: Storyteller and playstyle can be changed any time.
LanguageData.Difficulty_ThreatScale_Info: Adjust the size of threats like raids and infestations, and the difficulty of quests.
LanguageData.Difficulty_AllowBigThreats_Info: Allow major threats such as raids, infestations, manhunter packs, crashed mechanoid ships and more.
LanguageData.Difficulty_AllowViolentQuests_Info: Allow quests to present with violent threats and challenges. If this is disabled, quests will be modified to be non-violent.
LanguageData.Difficulty_AllowIntroThreats_Info: Enable the fixed intro threats that appear near game start.
LanguageData.Difficulty_PredatorsHuntHumanlikes_Info: Allow wild predators to hunt humans.
LanguageData.Difficulty_AllowExtremeWeatherIncidents_: Allow extreme weather incidents such as toxic fallout, volcanic winters and flashstorms.
LanguageData.Difficulty_TradePriceFactorLoss_Info: When trading, buy prices are increased by this amount while sell prices are reduced by this amount.
LanguageData.Difficulty_CropYieldFactor_Info: Adjust the amount of materials produced when harvesting plants and crops. This includes harvesting plants and cutting trees.
LanguageData.Difficulty_MineYieldFactor_Info: Adjust the amount of materials produced when mining.
LanguageData.Difficulty_ButcherYieldFactor_Info: Adjust the amount of materials produced when butchering. This includes meat, leather, and yield from shredding mechanoids.
LanguageData.Difficulty_QuestRewardValueFactor_Info: Adjust the value of rewards given for quests.\n\nNote: Quest reward value is also automatically scaled to compensate for threat scale. If you adjust this setting, you'll be adding an additional multiplier.
LanguageData.Difficulty_RaidLootPointsFactor_Info: Adjust the value of loot carried by raiders.\n\nNote: Raid loot value is also automatically scaled to compensate for threat scale. If you adjust this setting, you'll be adding an additional multiplier.
LanguageData.Difficulty_MaintenanceCostFactor_Info: Adjust the cost of rearming turrets.
LanguageData.Difficulty_ScariaRotChance_Info: The probability that a corpse will immediately rot upon death, if the creature has the scaria disease.\n\nNote: The default settings are designed to exactly balance out the increase in animal count at higher difficulties, so all players get the same meat rewards.
LanguageData.Difficulty_EnemyDeathOnDownedChanceFacto: Adjust the extra chance that an enemy will immediately die when downed. This affects the chances to take prisoners, and thus colony population growth rates.
LanguageData.Difficulty_ColonistMoodOffset_Info: A permanent mood offset applied to every colonist and prisoner. Colonists have a base mood of 50%.
LanguageData.Difficulty_FoodPoisonChanceFactor_Info: Adjust the chance that a person will get food poisoning from eating a potentially-poisoned meal.
LanguageData.Difficulty_ManhunterChanceOnDamageFactor: Adjust the chance that injuring a wild animal will cause it to attack.
LanguageData.Difficulty_FriendlyFireChanceFactor_Info: Adjust the chance of friendly fire.\n\nNote: This setting only affects direct shots which were going to hit their target. It does not prevent damage from explosions, or from shots which were going to miss their target.
LanguageData.Difficulty_AllowInstantKillChance_Info: Adjust the chance that a colonist can die instantly due to an attack. The incoming damage is adjusted so it will down the colonist instead.\n\nThis only prevents some kinds of instant kills - colonists can still be downed and bleed to death, die from fire, explosions, disease, and so on.
LanguageData.Difficulty_PlayerPawnInfectionChanceFact: Adjust the chance that a wound will become infected.
LanguageData.Difficulty_DiseaseIntervalFactor_Inverte: Adjust the frequency of random disease events.
LanguageData.Difficulty_EnemyReproductionRateFactor_I: Adjust the rate at which existing insect hives spawn new insects. Lower values means more time between spawn events.\n\nThis does not affect whether infestations can occur - only the speed at which active hives produce insects.
LanguageData.Difficulty_DeepDrillInfestationChanceFac: Adjust the chance that deep drilling will trigger an infestation.
LanguageData.Difficulty_PeacefulTemples_Inverted_Info: Ancient structures may contain dangerous threats.
LanguageData.Difficulty_AllowCaveHives_Info: Dormant insect hives may spawn in natural caves.\n\nThis setting only applies to map generation and does not affect active insects that may tunnel in during play.
LanguageData.Difficulty_AllowTraps_Info: Player can build traps like spike traps and IED traps.
LanguageData.Difficulty_AllowTurrets_Info: Player can build static turrets like mini-turrets, autocannon turrets, and uranium slug turrets.\n\nYou can still use captured turrets even if this is disabled.
LanguageData.Difficulty_AllowMortars_Info: Player can build mortars.\n\nYou can still use captured mortars even if this is disabled.
LanguageData.Difficulty_ClassicMortars_Info: Mortars will not require reinforced barrels to construct or reload, and are balanced for this ease of access.
LanguageData.Difficulty_AdaptationGrowthRateFactorOve: Adaptation means the storyteller makes the game more challenging when you're doing well. An adaptation score grows over time, and is knocked down when you take damage.\n\nThis setting adjusts how fast the adaptation score grows over time.
LanguageData.Difficulty_AdaptationEffectFactor_Info: Adaptation means the storyteller makes the game more challenging when you're doing well. An adaptation score grows over time, and is knocked down when you take damage.\n\nThis setting adjusts how much the adaptation score affects the difficulty.
LanguageData.Difficulty_FixedWealthMode_Info:
Play in a wealth-independent progress mode.

In normal mode, the storyteller scales threats according to colonist count, player wealth, and a variety of other factors. Wealth-independent mode removes the wealth factor and replaces it with a fixed progress curve based on time. The time is counted from the founding of each colony.

This is only recommended for those looking for a strict skill challenge. In wealth-independent mode, it may be nearly impossible to recover from serious losses unless you found a new settlement. It's also possible to get too far ahead of the curve and find the game too easy.
LanguageData.Difficulty_FixedWealthTimeFactor_Info: The number of game years until the wealth-independent mode reaches its maximum threat level.\n\nNote that the storyteller will still scale threats according to colonist count and a variety of other factors.
LanguageData.Difficulty_LowPopConversionBoost_Info:
With a single colonist of the player's starting ideoligion, conversion chance to his ideoligion is multiplied by this amount. Conversion attempts against them have their impact divided by that amount.

With two colonists of the player's starting ideoligion, the effect is halved.

With three or more colonists of the player's starting ideoligion, this has no effect.

LanguageData.GameStartDialog:
The three of you awake in your cryptosleep sarcophagi to the sound of sirens and ripping metal. You barely get to the escape pods before the ship is torn apart.

Some time later, you land on this unknown rimworld.

As pieces of the shredded starship fall around you, you start making plans to survive.
LanguageData.ChangeLanguageFromMainMenu: You can only change language from the options screen on the main menu.
LanguageData.MeatDesc: Raw butchered flesh. Can be cooked into meals, or eaten raw.
LanguageData.MeatInsectDesc: Raw butchered flesh. If necessary, can be cooked into meals, or even eaten raw. Extremely unappetizing.
LanguageData.MeatHumanDesc: Raw butchered flesh. Can be cooked into meals or eaten raw, although most humans dislike the idea.
LanguageData.TechprintDesc:
This is a techprint for the research project '{PROJECT_label}'. 
The physical form of techprints can range from scraps of paper with diagrams, all the way to advanced self-contained teaching machines. Regardless of form, they play the same role. They give your researchers the confidence that an idea is possible, and a rough idea of the designs used in more established societies. 
Your researchers need the foundational knowledge offered by techprints to know where to start on a given technology. Only after enough techprints have been applied can your researchers work out the fine details of how to make use of the technology in your particular situation. 
Applying techprints to a satisfied project fulfills half the remaining research progress. In addition, researchers always gain a boost to their intellectual skills when applying techprints, even on already-completed technologies.

LanguageData.NaturalGoodwillDescription: Natural goodwill is based on faction identities and beliefs. If current goodwill is far from natural goodwill, it will slowly shift towards natural goodwill over time.\n\nAll goodwill effects are multiplied by {0} when moving towards natural goodwill.
LanguageData.UnpennedTooltip: Animal pens can be created by building a pen marker inside an enclosed area. Your handlers will bring animals to an appropriate pen. Pens can be enclosed with fences, barricades, walls, and doors.

LanguageData.ShowLearningHelperWhenEmptyToggleButton: Toggle visibility of the learning helper when it is empty.\n\nThe learning helper is always visible if there is a concept activated to be learned. This toggle makes it disappear when no concept is active.
LanguageData.ShowBeautyToggleButton: Toggle the beauty display.\n\nDisplays the beauty of the world as would be perceived by a character standing where the mouse is pointing.
LanguageData.ShowRoomStatsToggleButton: Toggle room stats display.\n\nDisplays room stats of the room where the mouse is pointing.
LanguageData.ShowColonistBarToggleButton:
Toggle colonist bar.

Displays icons and basic status for all colonists along the top of the screen.

You can reorder the colonists in the colonist bar by right-click and dragging them.

LanguageData.ShowAnimalNamesToggleButton: Toggle displaying animal names for tame named animals.
LanguageData.ShowFertilityOverlayToggleButton: Toggle fertility overlay.\n\nThis shows how fertile the ground is, which affects what kinds of plants can grow and how fast they grow.
LanguageData.ShowTerrainAffordanceOverlayToggleButton:
Toggle visibility of terrain affordance.

This relates to what kinds of building can be constructed at each location.

For example, some types of ground only accept light or medium buildings, but not heavy ones. Bridges can only be built on water.

LanguageData.HibernateWarning:
(*Name)Charlon Whitestone(/Name) is ready to begin the reactor's hibernation recovery sequence.

He warns you that the process will take about 15 days, and the energy signature will be detectable from a long distance away.

This sort of energy signature indicates interstellar flight capability, and will attract gangs of desperate raiders and swarms of deadly mechanoids.

You will be assaulted with an intensity you've never seen. Make sure your defenses are prepared first.
LanguageData.HibernateWarningStandalone:
The reactor is ready to power up.

The process will take about 15 days, and the energy signature will be detectable from a long distance away. This sort of energy signature indicates interstellar flight capability, and will attract gangs of desperate raiders and swarms of deadly mechanoids.

You will be assaulted with an intensity you've never seen. Make sure your defenses are prepared first.
LanguageData.HibernateWarningPacifist: (*Name)Charlon Whitestone(/Name) is ready to begin the reactor's hibernation recovery sequence. He warns you that the process will take about 15 days.
LanguageData.HibernateWarningStandalonePacifist: The reactor is ready to power up. The process will take about 15 days.
LanguageData.SkillNeurotrainerDescription: A one-use super-dose of mechanites which trains a specific skill.\n\nThe dose is administered through the orbit of the eye. Once released into the brain, the mechanites quickly improve the subject's skills in a specific area, transmuting themselves into neural tissue as needed.
LanguageData.SkillNeurotrainerUsed: {USER_labelShort} used {1} neurotrainer to go from level {2} to level {3}.
LanguageData.Title: Title
LanguageData.QualityDescription: An item's quality is how well-made it is.
LanguageData.GameOverEveryoneDead: Everyone is dead or gone. This story is over.\n\nPerhaps someone else will find a use for the ruins of this place.
LanguageData.GameOverPlanetkillerImpact:
At near-lightspeed, the planetkiller weapon slammed into the ground with the force of a trillion hydrogen bombs. Like a water balloon shot with a rifle, this world liquified under the impact and sprayed its molten guts across the cosmos.

Part of {0} is now a small asteroid belt. The rest is a molten, radioactive hellscape, constantly rippling with kilometers-high planetquakes.

You did not survive.
LanguageData.GameOverShipLaunchedEnding: Your machine persona will now try to guide the ship to a safe place. It might find a prosperous planet in this system. Or, it may undertake a centuries-long journey to another star. It might even decide to hide under ice on an asteroid for a few thousand years, waiting for someone to build a new glitterworld here.\n\nYou'll find out when you wake up.
